articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The far-right group's former head was found guilty of seditious conspiracy for his involvement.
articles.title: Proud Boys: Enrique Tarrio to be sentenced over Capitol riot

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: An arms deal between North Korea and Russia could suit both sides, and allow them to work more closely.
articles.title: How worrying is a Russia-Kim Jong Un alliance?

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Dozens of girls are sent home after turning up at school wearing the now-banned abaya robe.
articles.title: French state schools turn away dozens of girls wearing Muslim abaya dress

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Part of the wall running through China's Shanxi province was dug open, causing severe damage.
articles.title: China's Great Wall damaged by workers looking for shortcut

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Pennsylvania police expand search area after new sightings of the escaped inmate on security cameras.
articles.title: Danelo Cavalcante: Pennsylvania schools close as manhunt for convicted murderer expands

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The 81-year-old Republican has frozen twice in as many months, prompting concerns about his health.
articles.title: Mitch McConnell: Doctor says no evidence of stroke or seizures in freezing spell

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Revellers are able to leave the desert festival after heavy rain made the ground too muddy to drive on.
articles.title: Burning Man: Revellers begin to leave as boggy conditions improve

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The flight from Atlanta to Barcelona was forced to turn around after a passenger had diarrhoea on board, reports say.
articles.title: Delta flight makes U-turn over diarrhoea incident

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The airline said a "systemwide technology issue" was to blame for the brief disruption.
articles.title: United Airlines briefly grounds all US flights after glitch

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.description: Jorge Vilda, Spain's Women's World Cup-winning head coach, has been sacked amid the ongoing Luis Rubiales kiss row.
articles.title: Vilda sacked as Spain boss amid Rubiales scandal
